intro: Xanthosia, commonly known as the golden bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, many of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. Xanthosia species often thrive in well-drained soils and are adapted to various climatic conditions. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in horticulture.
